note.p: Death: Ballymagarvey, near Drogheda, Ireland (19 December 1887)

Career: Entered the office of James Balfour, a relative; went to Australia (1855); gave up business (1856); Assistant observer, Kew Observatory (1856); Director, Kew Observatory (1859-1871); Professor of Natural Philosophy, Owen's College, Manchester (1870-1887); died of apoplexy
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1889 vol 46 pp ix-xi signed by P G T
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
